item.title: ğŸ– Honored as an Outstanding Reviewer of 2024 by IEEE TIM
item.description:
Recognition as an Outstanding Reviewer of 2024

I am honored to be recognized as an Outstanding Reviewer of 2024 by the IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement (TIM). This award highlights my contributions to rigorous and constructive peer review, ensuring the publication of high-quality research in instrumentation, measurement, and intelligent systems.

IEEE TIM is a leading journal covering advanced measurement techniques, sensor technology, and AI-driven industrial solutions. As a reviewer, I am committed to upholding academic integrity and helping researchers refine their work through insightful feedback.

Looking Forward ğŸš€

I look forward to continuing my engagement with IEEE TIM and supporting the global research community by contributing to innovation in Digital Health Technology.

item.title: ğŸ† Best Paper Award at IEEE ICHI 2024!
item.description:
ğŸ‰ Exciting News!

We are thrilled to share that our team at Kingâ€™s College London (KCL) has received the Best Paper Award at this yearâ€™s International Conference on Health Informatics (ICHI 2024)! This recognition highlights our commitment to leveraging digital technology to improve the lives of stroke survivors in London.

ğŸ¥ Our Research: A Web3-Based Patient Portal

In collaboration with clinicians, social scientists, computer science experts, patients, and the public, we have developed a Web3-powered patient portal. This innovative tool enables stroke survivors to:
âœ… Access their personal health records securely
âœ… Manage their recovery goals effectively
âœ… Improve user experience and accessibility in digital healthcare

Our work aims to empower patients in their healthcare journey, making health records more transparent, interactive, and patient-centered.

ğŸ™ Acknowledgments

This achievement would not have been possible without the outstanding leadership and support from my colleagues at Kingâ€™s:

  • Prof. Vasa Curcin
  • Dr. Iain Marshall
  • Prof. Charles Wolfe

A special thanks to the ICHI 2024 General Chairs, especially @Zhe He, for providing us with an excellent platform to present our research. Also, a huge appreciation to Davide Ferrari, PhD(c) for accepting the award on behalf of our team!

ğŸš€ We look forward to continuing our research and driving innovation in digital health!

Successful Conclusion of the 2025 Harvard HSIL Hackathon â€“ London Hub I am thrilled to announce the successful conclusion of the 2025 Harvard HSIL Hackathon â€“ London Hub, held on April 11â€“12! ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ğŸ‰ Led by Prof. Josip Car and organized by Dr. Lei Lu, the London Hub proudly joined 19 global hubs from 18 countries ğŸŒ to tackle pressing challenges in healthcare systems.

This yearâ€™s theme, â€œBuilding High-Value Health Systems: Leveraging Artificial Intelligenceâ€, brought together brilliant minds from academia, healthcare, and industry. Passionate students from prestigious institutions such as Oxford, Cambridge, Edinburgh, and leading London universities like Imperial, UCL, KCL, LSE, LSHTM, Greenwich, and more, participated in this event. ğŸ‘
